CLIMATE ACTION STARTS WITH US
The Scale
Climate
Accelerator
The Scale Climate
Accelerator

Climate Action
Starts with Us

Our Vision
To enable Asiaâ€™s world-class climate
businesses, while future-proofing
economies and creating a sustainable
economic legacy for Asia-Pacific

Reshaping the
climate.
One startup at
a time.
Climate Action Starts with Us

Picturing the Future
Source: The Progress Playbook
We believe Asia-Pacific will follow in Chinaâ€™s footsteps
toward decarbonization & electrification

The Problem
Scaling Effective Climate Solutions
Many of climate-first founders are already successful business
people growing businesses, but theyâ€™ve never raised capital before
and need training on topics from investor communications to
analytics and business intelligence systems, to VC deal terms.
We bridge the gap. With international networks of early adopters
looking for climate first products, and investors looking for climate-
first startups, as well as the know how to reach both audiances and
scale climate action.

The Opportunity
We look for great founders finding efficiencies, building products and services, and bringing in customers to tap into the
biggest economic opportunity of the century. We offer the capital, networks, and expertise they need to get to the next
level
Source: Bain & Co., GenZero, Standard Chartered and Tamasek - Southeast Asiaâ€™s Green Economy 2024
~5%
of SEA GDP
by 2030
Annually
The annual opportunity

Increase the speed of
capital deployment into
impactful climate solutions,
by enabling more startups
to become
scalable & attractive
investments
The
Solution Tap Into The Centuryâ€™s Largest Opportunity
Building relevant climate businesses, while future-proofing
economies and creating a lasting economic development legacy
for Asia-Pacific
Increase Quality Deal Flow
Depth and breadth across Asia-Pacific, enabled by the Scale
Climate Action events network across the region
De-risk Investments
By bringing startups through a 3 months-long program and long-
term support to accelerate their businesses and climate impact
The Scale Climate Accelerator provides
investors with the opportunity to:

18
Scale Climate Action
Weâ€™re ecosystems
builders
Since 2023, we've built Indonesiaâ€™s top sustainability
community through events showcasing climate solution
startups. We're expanding to Southeast Asia in 2024,
starting in Thailand.
Engaging with over 100 founders and investors revealed a
key challenge: climate investment capital exists but is
deploying too slowly, despite urgent need.
Also, our founding team has also been instrumental to
growing Accelerating Asia and creating meaningful
impact for 500 Global
Speakers
36
Organizations
31
Our Events Since July 2023
and counting...
Featured Speakers & Organizations

We only invest in startups
that are already on the path
to product-market fit - full-
time dedicated founders, a
min of US$ 3-5k in MRR, and a
clear customer acquisition
strategy
Our program combines a
heavy focus on metrics,
distribution, and pitching,
combined with
comprehensive support,
regional expertise and a
thriving climate business
ecosystem to take early stage
startups to the next level
For Fast Moving Startups 	Three Months of Acceleration
Our team already has 9 cohorts
under our belt, and global
business growth for companies
such as for Airbnb, Facebook,
and Tencent
Proven experience
Proven Accelerator Model

1. Investors
Our Structure
3. Startups	4. SCA Accelerator
3 months acceleration program
1 week in Bali
10 weeks online
1 week in Singapore for Demoday
Long-term Mentor & Alumni support network
$$$ 2. SCA Fund
USD 120k investment
per startup
0.5% bonus equity
Follow-on preference

Geo Focus
Climate Change is the largest global
economic opportunity of this century
because every business is a climate
business, and all businesses will go through
decarbonization
Asia-Pacific is one of the largest climate
addressable markets, Green House Gas
emitters, growing population, and one of the
most heavily impacted by Climate Change

Energy
(Asset Light)Built EnvironmentFood &
Agriculture
Sectorial Focus
We focus on sectors with significant GHG emissions and
reduction opportunities in Asia-Pacific
Logistics &
Mobility
Nature-Based
Solutions

General Partners
Jenn Yuen
General Partner
Renato Silva
General Partner
Alex Miller
General Partner
Alex serves Entrepreneur in Residence at
Accelerating Asia, where he has mentored and
invested in over 60 startups, and helped fund II
achieve an implied TVPI of 3.4x in 2 years. He is also
a mentor at Orbit and 500 Global.
Alex got his first exit in 2009, with the IPO of RenRen
Inc, where he was an early operator. Since then he
has operated in many startups including BTCJam
(bitcoin lending, 2012), GetCraft, where he was CTO
and ChatCenter.ai.
Renato has spent 20+ years scaling up businesses
in Europe, Asia & Latam, serving over 100 million
customers worldwide.
He has served as the Regional Head of Product at
Tencent, has operated in Southeast Asia for 16
years, is one of Scale Climate Actionâ€™s Co-Founders,
has founded 2 other startups and exited 1, advised
several startups in the region, and is also a mentor
at Orbit and a Terra.do Climate Fellow.
Jen is a Co-founder of Scale Climate Action,
advocate for Regenerative Business &
Leadership. 20+ years global experience in
marketing and tech (Airbnb, Meta).
Passionate about sustainability and social
impact. Based in Bali, is a Terra.do Climate
Fellow.

Climate Impact
Starts with Us
COME JOIN THE MOVEMENT AND SCALE CLIMATE ACTION
What are you waiting for?
Tremendous opportunity awaits.
renato@scaleclimateaction.com
scaleclimateaction.com

pages.text:
Alex 	Miller
Climate 	Impact
Accelerator
Climate Impact Starts With Us

ğŸŒğŸš€
Mission
Supplying the most ambitious
founders with the resources to
reshape the climate.

ğŸŒğŸš€
It 	looks 	like 	weâ€™re 	going 	to 	miss 	1.5C
Crisis: 	Climate 	& 	Environmental 	Destruction
69% of primary forest destroyed
87% of ocean no longer pristine wilderness
37% of rivers still free-flowing
23% Global land surface unaltered
80-85% of global primary energy from fossil fuels
No silver bullet - emissions are coming from every industry
Will humanity smother itself in emissions?
Problem
Source: Google Gemeni - todo: get the links

ğŸŒğŸš€
CRISIS
CHAOS
Hope
Opportunity
Problem/Solution

ğŸŒğŸš€
Where some see only
crisis and chaos, others
see 	Hope 	& 	Opportunity
Problem/Solution

ğŸŒğŸš€
Hope: 	Technological 	Explosion
Science, 	Technology 	& 	Engineering 	to 	the 	rescue
â€¢ 	8th decade of Morreâ€™s Law
â€¢ 	100 million scientists, engineers and technologists working globally
â€¢ 	AI breakthroughs disseminating across science, technology & engineering
â€¢ 	Rapid advances and dissemination of renewable energy, and sustainable
technologies to price parity or below
â€¢ 	Climate Change denial and disinformation no longer believable 	â†’ 	political &
regulatory change accelerating
â€¢ 	James Inhofe Dead
å¸Œæœ›

ğŸŒğŸš€
The 	Opportunity 	of 	the 	Century
Adoption 	is 	coming, 	enabling 	the 	supply 	is 	visionary.
â€¢ 	Necessities like food, clothing, shelter, energy, mobility and logistics which are
the main drivers of climate change, are also the main drivers of GDP.
â€¢ 	With all of this demand, and all of these engineers and technology, millions of
new businesses will be created to delay and mitigate climate change.
â€¢ 	In the decade to come the most ambitious founders with the right capital,
knowledge and networks will reshape the global economy, and generate
immense returns.
â€¢ 	The Climate Impact Accelerator will seek out, fund, and enable the best
founders through this tumultuous period, reshaping the world, and earning a
huge return on capital.

ğŸŒğŸš€
The 	Opportunity 	of 	the 	Century
If 	we 	believe 	that 	thereâ€™s 	hope, 	then
Every 	business 	is 	gonna 	have 	to 	be 	a 	climate 	business
â€¢ 	Just look at china. The future is there. Everything is electric and fast and
quiet and just works, or you get it 	fixed, and its manufactured cheaply
because its manufactured at scale with a vast and interconnected supply
chain thatâ€™s fast and relatively local.
â€¢ 	Now look at india. The government mandates are kicking in and forcing
change across vast industries. But they dont have the origins of diversity.
â€¢ 	Thatâ€™s going to happen everywhere.
â€¢ 	Mobility and logistics, food and agriculture, construction and materials - the
main drivers of climate change - are also the drivers GDP - and theyâ€™ve all
gotta change.
æœºä¼š. Every Biz Affected, many winners. A rising tide lifts all boats. Conversely a low tide can
wreak boats too close to sureâ€¦ so the world will swim harder and get through the whitewater.
Copy 	Paste 	Innovation
into 	Emerging 	Markets

ğŸŒğŸš€
Background: Crisis / Hope /
Opportunity / Chaos

ğŸŒğŸš€
â€¢ 	Is chaos not coming?
â€¢ 	Or will chaos come to soon and we should just give up?
â€¢ 	NO. We have a chance to stop chaos from coming.
â€¢ 	Thatâ€™s why

ğŸŒğŸš€
Climate Impact Starts With Us

ğŸŒğŸš€
Asia 	to 	the 	Rescue
A 	region 	full 	of 	need, 	and 	innovation
â€¢ 	60% of the worlds population resides in Asia
â€¢ 	China is the global manufacturing center, supply chain is now spreading regionally
â€¢ 	â€œThe future is unevenly distributedâ€ and many still living in poverty
â€¢ 	Low cost, low resource and even DIY solutions are of central importance
â€¢ 	Large numbers of startups in every sector, but especially resource intensive
necessities like food, clothing, shelter, energy, mobility and logistics which are the
main drivers of climate change
â€¢ 	Increasing amount of startup capital and know-how available.

ğŸŒğŸš€
Opportunity: 	Accelerating 	Fledgling 	Climate 	Startups
The 	Opportunity 	of 	the 	Century
â€¢ 	Lower cost of ownership and higher yields are driving grass-roots creation
and adoption of new green technologies across Asia
â€¢ 	Leap frogging generations of technology entrenched in the west
â€¢ 	At the enterprise, policy is also driving rapid shifts to new, clean solutions
â€¢ 	BUT ecosystems donâ€™t yet have capacity to serve all new demand
â€¢ 	You 	can 	help 	foster growth by building the next generation of supply
â€¢ 	Vast riches await.

ğŸŒğŸš€
Mooreâ€™s 	New 	Laws
Everything 	getting 	cheaper, 	leading 	to 	more 	adoption, 	fast
â€¢ 	2-3 Wheeled Fleets
â€¢ 	Renewables/Batteries/Smart Energy
â€¢ 	Agri-tech / Food Supply
â€¢ 	Nature Based Startups / Carbon Markets
â€¢ 	Circular Economy
â€¢ 	Social Issues: Health/Wellness/Education
Sample 	Thesis, 	show 	your 	genus
Agri-tech
Fastest 	Growing 	Markets
2 	wheeled 	Fleets
Nature 	Based 	Solutions

ğŸŒğŸš€
Technological 	Tipping 	Points 	Reached
When 	green 	becomes 	cheaper 	than 	the 	old 	way, 	people 	switch
â€¢ 	EV Fleets are now cheaper gas 	fleets
â€¢ 	Solar cheaper than generators, or paying the power company
â€¢ 	Microbe-based fertilizer cheaper and more productive than NPK
â€¢ 	Water 	filters cheaper than boiling / trucking water in
â€¢ 	Harvesting methane cheaper than buying LPG
â€¢ 	Etc.

ğŸŒğŸš€
But 	upfront 	cash 	is 	required
When 	things 	become 	cheaper 	than 	the 	old 	way

ğŸŒğŸš€
Our 	Vision: 	An 	Accelerator 	& 	VC 	for 	Climate 	Tech
Enabling 	the 	best 	founders
â€¢ 	Fund: $200k @ Market Rate + 3% Equity
â€¢ 	Teach & Share: 12 week program - Retreat, Online, Singapore Demo Day
â€¢ 	Learn metrics, storytelling, investor relations
â€¢ 	operational and strategic expertise.
â€¢ 	Mentor: Top mentors from across the region offering office hours
â€¢ 	Network: Bi-weekly networking bringing together the best minds and
operators

â€¢ 	Alex Miller

ğŸŒğŸš€
Story Lines
Content Marketing Prompts

ğŸŒğŸš€
Deck Story Lines

ğŸŒğŸš€
How 	will 	I 	excuse 	myself 	when 	Iâ€™m 	old?
I 	saw 	it 	coming 	but 	I 	continued 	on 	my 	way 	to 	the 	dentist?
â€¢ 	Its time to cancel the appointment
â€¢ 	We can see this shit is real. (Slide 2 anybody?)
â€¢ 	Give your heart and soul - help others.
â€¢ 	Mentor, volunteer, invest - 	LendForGood.com, Kiva,
â€¢ 	Get a job in climate - 	ClimateBase.com
â€¢ 	Create Buiness Action - 	ScaleClimateAction.com
â€¢

ğŸŒğŸš€
The 	Entprerenurs 	in 	Residence
We 	actually 	go 	reside 	with 	each 	team 	for 	a 	little 	while
â€¢ 	Go to their place of bisness and sit for a week
â€¢ 	If after a week, we believe, we write a memo and add a syndicate to the backlog
â€¢ 	We bring in all the investors who are interested
â€¢ 	And immediately our short-term incentives for proper DD diverges from the investors and converges to the sellers.
â€¢ 	Unless weâ€™re investing in cashflow companies and we take dividends
â€¢ 	Can our innovators make cashflow buinesses with dividends?
â€¢ 	Are we promising Abhi and Avika the world ? Its not there for the taking.
â€¢ 	Theyâ€™re smart and the world is changing so fast. They seem to be making customers and have a lot of cash
â€¢ 	Itâ€™s the nature of a well run buiness in an expanding niche to expand.
â€¢ 	Or is the market too competitive, the bets too uncertain?
â€¢ 	We better look carefully at the books. Her dad is in show biz and his is a ruby dealer. They might know how to make books. I actually believe in these folks 100%, dont get me
wrong. But $100k is an awful lot of moneyâ€¦ why not spend a week on a farm to take a closer look.
â€¢ 	And also a car factory
â€¢ 	And a mayanÄ±
â€¢ 	Can I travel for work? How much? I dont mind trains. If im going to see a factory or a farm or facility, Iâ€™ll take dion and make sure he gets his Montesorri homework done.

ğŸŒğŸš€
Content Marketing

Lets 	call 	it 	Universal 	Energy
The 	term 	â€œRenewable 	energy" 	is 	sandbagging 	the 	industry
â€¢ 	Think of the word renewable

â€¢ 	Its dirty

that it creates.
â€¢ 	Universal is energy that the universe has given us.
â€¢ 	Its solar, its wind, its earthâ€™s heat (geothermal), and and sinusoidal tidal generators too. It may
also be energy we derive from fusing an atom. If it can be safely miniaturized, it should be free
for all to copy and spread.

Origins 	of 	Diversity 	Theory
When 	new 	things 	appear, 	thereâ€™s 	often 	a 	lot 	of 	diversity.
â€¢ 	In Biology things sometimes evolve multiple times, but usually, its only once.
â€¢ 	If we 	find the thing widely spread, we expect it to have been widely transported from origin to multiple
destinations.
â€¢ 	Take the potato. It grew up in the Andes, and then people took it by boat to to Ireland.
â€¢ 	and then they are transported relatively whole, to other spheres of growth, where they again dissimate

â€¢ 	It originates in Detroit, spreads across america, with many brands and makes and models and model
years of American car, and then resurfaces in Japan where you get Nissan and Toyota and Honda, then
China, where weâ€™re now seeing a wealth of supply chain grow up to meet demand. And now also in
Thailand, where the local company is now the number one producer of cars. Our dream is that many years
from now, in bangladesh, and the region, hot swappable batteries will replace dielsel.

ğŸŒğŸš€
It 	looks 	like 	weâ€™re 	going 	to 	miss 	1.5C
Crisis: 	Climate 	& 	Environmental 	Destruction
69% of primary forest destroyed
87% of ocean no longer pristine wilderness
37% of rivers still free-flowing
23% Global land surface unaltered
80-85% of global primary energy from fossil fuels
No silver bullet - emissions are coming from every industry
Will humanity smother itself in emissions?
Problem

ğŸŒğŸš€
Hope: 	Technological 	Explosion
Science, 	Technology 	& 	Engineering 	to 	the 	rescue
â€¢ 	8th decade of Morreâ€™s Law
â€¢ 	100 million scientists, engineers and technologists working globally
â€¢ 	AI breakthroughs disseminating across science, technology & engineering
â€¢ 	Rapid advances and dissemination of renewable energy, and sustainable
technologies to price parity or below
â€¢ 	Climate Change denial and disinformation no longer believable 	â†’ 	political &
regulatory change accelerating
â€¢ 	James Inhofe Dead

ğŸŒğŸš€
The 	Opportunity 	of 	the 	Century
Adoption 	is 	coming, 	enabling 	the 	supply 	is 	visionary.
â€¢ 	Necessities like food, clothing, shelter, energy, mobility and logistics which are
the main drivers of climate change, are also the main drivers of GDP.
â€¢ 	With all of this demand, and all of these engineers and technology, millions of
new businesses will be created to delay and mitigate climate change.
â€¢ 	In the decade to come the most ambitious founders with the right capital,
knowledge and networks will reshape the global economy, and generate
immense returns.
â€¢ 	The Climate Impact Accelerator will seek out, fund, and enable the best
founders through this tumultuous period, reshaping the world, and earning a
huge return on capital.

-- 7 of 61 --

ğŸŒğŸš€
The 	Opportunity 	of 	the 	Century
If 	we 	believe 	that 	thereâ€™s 	hope, 	then
Every 	business 	is 	gonna 	have 	to 	be 	a 	climate 	business
â€¢ 	Just look at china. The future is there. Everything is electric and fast and
quiet and just works, or you get it 	fixed, and its manufactured cheaply
because its manufactured at scale with a vast and interconnected supply
chain thatâ€™s fast and relatively local.
â€¢ 	Now look at india. The government mandates are kicking in and forcing
change across vast industries. But they dont have the origins of diversity.
â€¢ 	Thatâ€™s going to happen everywhere.
â€¢ 	Mobility and logistics, food and agriculture, construction and materials - the
main drivers of climate change - are also the drivers GDP - and theyâ€™ve all
gotta change.
æœºä¼š. Every Biz Affected, many winners. A rising tide lifts all boats. Conversely a low tide can
wreak boats too close to sureâ€¦ so the world will swim harder and get through the whitewater.

main drivers of climate change
